1988-2019 Loring McAlpin is a documentary filmmaker and a founding member of the AIDS activist art collective Gran Fury. From 1988 to 1995, Gran Fury adapated strategies from artistic communities to interrupt traditional advertising spaces. The collective created posters, stickers, ephemera, and other graphic art alongisde ACT UP New York as part of larger organizing efforts to increase awareness during the AIDS crisis and to protest the silence, indifference, or hostility of many public figures during this time period. The Loring McAlpin Collection on Gran Fury (dated 1988-2019) consists of materials created and collected by McAlpin documenting the AIDS activist art collective Gran Fury. Materials in this collection include photographs, posters, design mock-ups, exhibition documentation, and interview transcripts. The materials document the group's efforts to educate and raise awareness of the AIDS crisis, as well as protest harmful AIDS policies. More broadly, the collection demonstrates the role of art within AIDS activism during the time period. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Loring McAlpin Collection on Gran Fury (dated 1988-2019) consists of materials created and collected by McAlpin documenting the AIDS activist art collective Gran Fury. Materials in this collection include photographs, posters, design mock-ups, exhibition documentation, and interview transcripts. The materials document the group's efforts to educate and raise awareness of the AIDS crisis, as well as protest AIDS policies and indifference displayed by many public officials. The collection also documents more recent reflection on Gran Fury's work and impact in the broader AIDS activism sphere, as shown through gallery catalogs, ephemera, and interviews. In addition to its documentary focus on Gran Fury, this collection demonstrates the role of art within AIDS activism during the time period.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
All artwork by Gran Fury is in the public domain. Other materials in this collection are protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Loring McAlpin in March 2023; the accession number associated with this gift is 2023.036.
Born-Digital Access Policies and Procedures
Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. An access terminal for born-digital materials in the collection is available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Researchers may view an item's original container and/or carrier, but the physical carriers themselves are not available for use because of preservation concerns.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Loring McAlpin Collection on Gran Fury; MSS 627; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level with a folder-level inventory. Born-digital items on physical carriers were identified, physically separated, inventoried, imaged, analyzed, and described. One optical disc could not be imaged due to errors. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.
Biographical Note
Loring McAlpin is a documentary filmmaker and a founding member of the AIDS activist art collective Gran Fury. From 1988 to 1995, Gran Fury created posters, stickers, ephemera, and other graphic art alongisde ACT UP New York as part of larger organizing efforts to increase awareness during the AIDS crisis and to protest the silence, indifference, or hostility of many public figures during this time period. McAlpin is also the founder of The Calamus Foundation, which works to support LGBTQ+ organizations that focus on social justice and civil rights pursuits.
Appraisal
Blank optical discs or discs with title cards only were appraised out of the collection.
